{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2969849,"name":"Heather Hill Frisch","username":"Heafr1617","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/h/e79b87/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-09-29T15:59:28.384Z","cooked":"

We are Building a swerve drive train using 8 talon fx and 4 CTR Cancoders. We have figured out the can wires but have gotten mixed answers on wiring the power wires. If we wire them to the VRM what ports do we use keeping in mind one 12v/2a is already being used for connection to the PDP. Is the PDP an option and if so how?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2021-09-29T15:59:28.384Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":864,"reads":322,"readers_count":321,"score":4389.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":396275,"topic_slug":"how-to-wire-4-ctr-cancoder-to-to-talon-fx-motors","display_username":"Heather Hill Frisch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49505,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-wire-4-ctr-cancoder-to-to-talon-fx-motors/396275/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2969860,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2021-09-29T16:42:46.725Z","cooked":"
Heafr1617:

one 12v/2a is already being used for connection to the PDP.

The power wires from the PDP should go to the 12Vin ports. You shouldn‚Äôt need to provide any power back to the PDP. Edit: If you meant the radio, OK. Many recommend using the PDP powering the radio to be used ONLY for that purpose.
In any case, the CANcoder only requires 60mA, so you could power all four off of the 500mA bus on a VRM. You could also power directly from any of the PDP circuits. Remember that only one wire can be in any of the PDP ports, so you will have to have some sort of splice or terminal block to feed all four from one supply. This is mandatory for the PDP (2020 R49), and recommended for the Weidmuller connectors (2020 R73 blue box).

Just so you know, the TalonFX has encoders built in. Maybe that will help you in your application? Would work on swerve unless its a differential swerve (I think)

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2021-09-29T16:46:42.598Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":292,"readers_count":291,"score":98.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":396275,"topic_slug":"how-to-wire-4-ctr-cancoder-to-to-talon-fx-motors","display_username":"Chadfrom7226","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20021,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-wire-4-ctr-cancoder-to-to-talon-fx-motors/396275/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2969903,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2021-09-29T19:59:27.383Z","cooked":"
Chadfrom7226:

Would work on swerve unless its a differential swerve (I think)

Even with differential swerve, the built-in encoders can be accessed and used to keep track of the wheel orientation - in theory. In either case (differential or traditional swerve), the built-in encoders will not be able to provide a true angle for the wheel unless the wheels are intentionally aligned to a known configuration during field placement, or have an additional index sensor. On the other hand, CANcoder reports an absolute position (you may need to calibrate when you build or re-build, but NOT every time you turn the robot on). Also in either case, there will be backlash between the motor position and the wheel orientation due to the gearing down from the motor to the wheel angle. Differential would add another wrinkle, in that there are two encoders which need to be tracked for each wheel, and the backlash is present for each motor, and they‚Äôre not necessarily tracking each other.

That‚Äôs a good point. I didn‚Äôt think about reboots

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2021-09-29T20:54:19.832Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":237,"readers_count":236,"score":107.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":396275,"topic_slug":"how-to-wire-4-ctr-cancoder-to-to-talon-fx-motors","display_username":"Chadfrom7226","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":22335,"username":"GeeTwo","name":"Gus Michel II","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20021,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-wire-4-ctr-cancoder-to-to-talon-fx-motors/396275/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2969919,"name":"Patrick Woolfenden","username":"PatrickW","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrickw/{size}/129934_2.png","created_at":"2021-09-29T21:00:03.355Z","cooked":"

You can power the CANCoders from the VRM. Putting them all on a single 12V 500ma port works well.

A lot of teams prefer to plug them into a single PDP port on a 20amp breaker that is dedicated to powering the limelight(s) and extra sensors such as the CANCoders. The advantage of this approach is that the only thing plugged into the VRM is the radio POE which is good for connection reliability. The CANcoders do fine on unregulated 12V from the PDP since they accept a very wide range of supply voltage.

Whichever approach you take, you can not have more than one wire going into a port. Have a single wire go into the port and then branch off after that. There are many options for this such a splicing in wires with solder and heat shrink or using wago lever nuts.

We are in a similar situation. Would something like the PowerPole Distribution Block from AndyMark or the XT30 Distribution Block by REV work for this situation? Power one of these distribution blocks off of the PDP and supplying all of the CANcoders and maybe a LImelight and/or a Network Switch? Assuming correct wire gauges, connectors and breaker ratings‚Ä¶

andymark.com

Powerpole Distribution Board

You won't find a better power distribution setup than this board. Use it for testing intakes, arms, testing full robots, and more!The best in simple power distribution is here. This board features six individually fused outputs, accepting...

andymark.com

XT30 Power Distribution Block

The XT30 is a connector designed to be a reliably firm hold and quality connection. With this power block,¬†the connection from your robot's battery to multiple devices is made simple!The Distribution Block comes with ONE 30cm XT30 Extension...

I am not completely sure if these components are legal for FRC competition. Maybe a LRI/RI can chime in and provided some feedback?

Based on Greg‚Äôs response of ‚ÄúOh hi‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ more info coming soon.‚Äù and not ‚ÄúPlease do not leak confidential slideshows, enjoy your ban.‚Äù, I imagine this would have been posted publicly shortly afterwards anyway. This talk also appears to have been publicly posted on YouTube before this was posted. Edit: [image]

A simple option that has not yet been mentioned is to use the +6V power from some of the PWM ports; you could use 4 ports for this to save a PDP slot. +6V should be fine for powering CANcoders, as this is a regulated supply. Although it cuts off under brownout conditions, this doesn‚Äôt happen until the main supply is around 6V anyway ‚Äì the spec‚Äôed lower limit for CANcoders.

I wouldn‚Äôt do this if I had a spare PDP port ‚Äì but if I didn‚Äôt (no shiny new REV PDP), I wouldn‚Äôt take this off the table.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2021-12-20T01:29:38.693Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":145,"readers_count":144,"score":79.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":396275,"topic_slug":"how-to-wire-4-ctr-cancoder-to-to-talon-fx-motors","display_username":"Allen Nuttle","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14283,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-to-wire-4-ctr-cancoder-to-to-talon-fx-motors/396275/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2982609,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2021-12-20T15:39:59.554Z","cooked":"
bchina:

I am not completely sure if these [power distribution] components are legal for FRC competition. Maybe a LRI/RI can chime in and provided some feedback?

With the usual caveat that this is for the 2020 rules; they may change next year.

  • You cannot wire these directly into the main breaker, nor directly to the battery (R40). There is no problem using them behind one of the breakers on the PDP to power custom circuits, including sensors (blue box below R52).
  • For the XT30 distribution block, the wiring would be based on the breaker in the PDP. Note that this block is rated for 20A total, so use a 20A (or smaller) breaker in the PDP.
  • For the fused PowerPole board, wiring size is based on the smaller of the breakers in the PDP and on that leg from the board. (R53 just says ‚Äúprotected circuit‚Äù; it does not specify where that protection may be).
  • The CANcoder recommends wires of ~20A, so I recommend using 5A or smaller breakers/fuses for this purpose to comply with R53 and manufacturer‚Äôs recommendations*. If you‚Äôre also looking to power other custom circuits off the same PDP breaker, this makes the PowerPole board much more attractive; you could put a 40A breaker in the PDP and a 5A in the leg of your PP board powering the CANCoders.
  • If you just like XT30 connectors, know that AndyMark also has a 6 channel power distribution board with breakers or fuses for XT30. AM doesn‚Äôt have specs posted (I‚Äôve put in a help ticket), but the input XT30 is rated for 30A, and AM refers to using 30A fuses/breakers, so until I hear otherwise, I‚Äôll presume that the rating is 30A per channel, 30A total.
  • Note that while R50 only explicitly lists breakers allowed in the PDP, I would follow this for use in the distribution board as well.

* I recall seeing posts describing difficulty passing larger insulated wires through the opening in sensor housings and stripped ends into the sensor board solder points.
